description: Patterns detecting sycophancy, hedge words, corporate speak, and unnecessary repetition

patterns.name: Great Question Opener
patterns.explanation: Opening with praise for the question is a known sycophancy pattern that adds no value and often feels performative.

patterns.name: Happy To Help
patterns.explanation: Corporate cheerfulness that simulates enthusiasm rather than demonstrating competence.
examples: I'm happy to assist you with that.

patterns.name: Absolutely Affirmation
patterns.explanation: Excessive affirmation that often precedes restating the question.
examples: Absolutely, I can help with that.

patterns.name: Hope This Helps
patterns.explanation: Closing filler that adds no information and can feel dismissive.

patterns.name: Let Me Know
examples: Let me know if you have any questions!
Let me know if you need anything else.

patterns.name: Feel Free To
patterns.explanation: Permission-granting phrase that can feel condescending.
examples: Feel free to ask if you have questions.

patterns.name: As An AI
patterns.explanation: Unnecessary self-identification that often precedes refusal or hedging.
examples: As an AI, I don't have personal opinions.
As an AI language model, I cannot...

patterns.name: Language Model Declaration
patterns.explanation: Technical self-description that disrupts natural conversation flow.
examples: As a large language model, I was trained on...
As a language model, I don't have access to...

patterns.name: Important To Note
patterns.explanation: Hedge phrase that often precedes obvious information or unnecessary caveats.

patterns.name: Please Note
patterns.explanation: Formal hedge that can feel paternalistic.
examples: Please note that this may vary.

patterns.name: That Being Said
patterns.explanation: Transitional hedge that often introduces contradiction or caveat.
examples: That being said, there are some exceptions.
Having said that, you should also consider...

patterns.name: However Caveat
patterns.explanation: Caveat introduction that often precedes unnecessary warnings.

patterns.name: Leverage
patterns.explanation: Corporate buzzword used when 'use' would suffice.
examples: You can leverage this feature to...

patterns.name: Facilitate
patterns.explanation: Vague corporate verb that obscures meaning.
